meanings.definition: Not forming an essential or central part
meanings.sent1: The noncore decorations were easily removed from the room.
meanings.sent2: The noncore details of the painting were easily overlooked.
meanings.sent3: The noncore items in the gift bag were the most interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her noncore interests in astronomy shone brightly during the star-gazing event.
meanings.sent5: The noncore elements of the puzzle were the most challenging to fit together.

meanings.definition: Not belonging to the core or central group
meanings.sent1: The noncore members of the team had unique skills.
meanings.sent2: The noncore participants brought fresh perspectives to the discussion.
meanings.sent3: The noncore characters in the story added unexpected twists.
meanings.sent4: Her noncore friends were the ones who truly understood her.
meanings.sent5: The noncore ingredients in the recipe gave it a special flavor.

meanings.sent1: The noncore features of the app were rarely used.
meanings.sent2: The noncore rules could be overlooked in certain situations.
meanings.sent3: The noncore tasks were left for last on the to-do list.
meanings.sent4: Her noncore responsibilities allowed her more free time.
meanings.sent5: The noncore characters in the movie provided comic relief.
